title: Malphite Top Lane build and some questions
body:
If I was playing a top lane malphite what would should I build for AD or tank (the ones I see suggested at the moment seem kind of bad)

Also at what point should I be leaving my lane to help teamates/teamfight ?

Thanks for anyone who helps

replies.body:
When should you leave you lane to help your team mates? Only when you need to help them secure objectives e.g. towers, dragon, baron ect... or when you see an opportunity to TP gank otherwise you can always roam mid when your ult is up but 9x/10 you just end up wasting your time. 

On Malphite Top you typically want to use these runes: 
AD red's, 
Armor yellow's, 
Magic Resists Per Level Blue's and 
Movement Speed Quints.

With Masteries you typically want to go 4/23/3, 
putting your 4 offensive points into CDR (Cooldown reduction) 
and 3 utility points into MS (Movement speed), 
the 23 defensive points are pretty obvious. 

You want to build Malphite tank (AD Malphite sucks and AP Malphite deals a lot of damage but is super squish and loses against most top laners) 
When you're laning against an AD top laner ALWAYS get Frozen Heart first, why? because it works extremely well with Malphites E and basically shuts down champions that rely on Auto Attacks to deal damage, if you're laning against an AP champion Spirit Visage is the best way to start and then build accordingly, like most builds it really does depend on the matchup and who the biggest threat is on the enemy team so it essentially all comes down to your knowledge of the game, knowing what items work well with your champion and also what works best against your opponents.

Hope that helps, if not you can always look up an in depth guide.

Why do you build Malphite for AD. He is not ranged, and not AD champ.
Always go for tank with him. Why? Because of his ult mech.

Builds are super dependent on the enemy team, here's a few things I look out for to determine my build;

1. What is the primary damage source of their Top and Jungle (maybe even consider their midlaner)
If their top and jungle are primarily AP then I look to build a abyssal if I am ahead or a spirit visage if I am even or behind
If their top and jungle are primarily AD I look to go randuins OR sunfire into a frozen heart
If its a mix I build randuins or sunfire into a spirit visage then frozen heart

A few general tips Malphite is inherently tanky thanks to his W (which gives him % bonus armour) AND E (which reduces atk speed of opponents hit) Building a combination of armour and MR and health is always the most effective way to be a tank.

He also has decent AP ratios and most of his damage is Magic so getting Abyssal can boost your threat levels and really help you soften up the enemy teams back line when you ult in

Usually I always look to roam when I have ult, whether thats TPing bot or just running down to mid. Malphites ultimate is devastating in team fights and during ganks. Make use of it to get kills and most importantly objectives after the kills.

Hope that helps
I only play him against heavy AD teams, And I always build armor, with a sunfire  thorns etc.. the other team normally end up killing themself on you this way.  If they are AP heavy dont pick him.
